data.title: Copy Path from bottom Status Bar
data.body:
Hello!

There is a nice file path at the bottom left of every window, however, that file path cannot be copied to the clipboard. Why is this? 

Thanks!

data.title: Make numeric keypad mimic regular keypad
data.body:
I'm used to working with the numeric keypad instead of the 'regular' one. In all the editors I've used, the two have acted the same. 

In Atom, numeric keypad keys are recognized as separate keys and thus require their own keybinds. If one wants to use the numeric keypad, one needs to tediously add custom keybinds for everything from up and down to ctrl-home and shift-del. 

Is there a way to make the numeric keypad keys be recognized as their non-numeric counterparts, or, alternatively, introduce custom key-remapping?

data.title: Packages menu in windows doesn't show F3 in command
data.body:
When creating a new package it shows up fine in the package menu with one exception.  The key binding is ctrl-F3 but it the command is missing the F3.  It only shows "Ctrl+".

Here is my key binding  ...

```
'.workspace':
  'ctrl-F3': 'find-selection:find-next'
```

... and the menu code ...

```
'menu': [
  {
    'label': 'Packages'
    'submenu': [
      'label': 'Find Selection'
      'submenu': [
        { 'label': 'Find Next', 'command': 'find-selection:find-next' }
      ]
    ]
  }
]
```

This is with atom 0.115.0 and windows 8.0 installed with chocolatey.

data.title: [Windows] Explorer Shortcut Issues
data.body:
Unless I am missing an option somewhere (very possibly) the explorer shortcut opens a file in a new Atom window instead of another tab within an already open window. :(

Secondly, it appears that shortcuts to documents on a networked location such as a CIFS share (ex: \192.168.1.100\c$\etc\messages) do not seem to work. Opens a blank document instead of either the shortcut file or the file it is referencing.

data.title: Atom crashes immediately after opening on Windows 7 x64
data.body:
Hi,

I installed Atom via Chocolatey (and also tried the ZIP file), but I cannot use it. The installation runs fine, but whenever I run the executable, I get a popup window with a _"The editor has crashed"_ error message, which includes 3 buttons: Close Window, Reload and Keep It Open:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/724969/3572974/377779e2-0b6d-11e4-9b80-146a35193ddc.png)

Quickly searching through the code repo, I found out that this error message is generated by the handler of the `@browserWindow.webContents.on 'crashed'` event (in `/src/browser/atom-window.coffee`), but I don't know what could be causing the browserWindow to crash, since my teammates' computers are identical to mine, and they can all run it just fine.

I've just updated to version 0.115.0, but the error persists.

Thanks,
Luciano.

data.title: Don't quote certain explorer arguments
data.body:
This seems to be required since wrapping the common `/root,` and `/select,` arguments in quotes causes them to not be interpreted correctly.

Refs atom/tree-view#180

data.title: [Windows] Show in Explorer prompts for default application
data.body:
Windows 7, Atom 0.114.0

I created a new file test and saved it. Opened the tree view using Ctrl + 0. Right clicked the file and clicked 'Show in Explorer' and the Select default application dialogue pops up.

Edit: it's worth noting that test does not have a file extension. Regardless this should open the folder containing the file, not attempt to open the file itself.

![croppercapture 4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1620641/3570804/bb10e40e-0b55-11e4-89c9-57a6b034645c.Gif)

but i want change the old file's name.

data.title: [OS X] Atom shell command should not show a (temporary) second dock icon when Atom is already open
data.body:
Having _Atom_ running, when you open additional files (or try to open a file that you have already open) from the _Terminal_, _OS X's Dock_ will show a temporary second _Atom_ icon (and then it goes away). This should not be the case.

See how _TextMate_ 1.5.x doesn't do this when you use the _mate_ shell command. Same for opening _Sublime Text_ running _subl_ from the terminal.

data.title: Item(s) missing from keybindings list in Settings view
data.body:
v115 on Win8

Not sure about other platforms, but on WIndows we have at least two confirmed cases where searching for the keybinding for the Settings View does not show it in the list:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3568418/457223fe-0b30-11e4-9eff-502cb865d8f7.png)

Described in [this topic](http://discuss.atom.io/t/key-binding-to-bring-up-setting/10748/7) on discuss.

The key binding still works (if not previously overwritten), i.e. `Ctrl-,` opens the Settings view:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3568430/771b9f34-0b30-11e4-89f4-34086e35fe8a.png)

I do not know if there are any other items missing from the list, might just be the only one.

data.title: Add --reset option for wiping ~/.atom/storage
data.body:
Occasionally we get instances where someone's editor has some wedged serialized state that is preventing them from opening Atom properly. When this happens, they need to be instructed on how to find `~/.atom/storage` (or the platform-specific equivalent) and to delete or move it. It would be very helpful to have an `atom --reset` command, like the `atom --safe` command that would either:
1. Delete `~/.atom/storage` prior to loading the rest of Atom
2. Package up `~/.atom/storage` and send it off to GitHub before deleting it (with the user's permission)

data.title: Allow React editors to be used as mini-editors with core.useReactMiniEditors option
data.body:
This is basically working, but the biggest remaining obstacle is determining when React-mini-editors are hidden in a comprehensive way.
- [x] Don't show wrap guide in mini editors
- [x] Don't capture mouse wheel events in mini editors
- [x] Clean up all the DOM measurement sequences
- [x] Display placeholder/initial text correctly in settings view
- [x] Handle editors being mounted in an invisible state
- [x] Fix padding + colors combination
- [ ] Review old editor specs and make sure we cover everything
- [x] Check that styling matches

data.title: Clicking toolbar menus doesn't work until after I open them through keyboard
data.body:
I'm on Ubuntu 13.10. The toolbar menu is attached to the top of the screen rather than the window as is usual. However, clicking on the buttons in the toolbar doesn't work. The button in the toolbar stands out as it should when it's clicked, but no menu appears below. If I press alt and the first letter of the menu entry (like alt+v for the view menu), then the menu opens, but attached to the window instead of the toolbar, and without the dark-gray toolbar styling. Then after that, I can open that menu by clicking it through the toolbar normally. Though other menus and submenus are still broken until I open them through the keyboard.

Here's a series of four screenshots: https://imgur.com/Ud5hFbv,LJpcCdQ,rWAcCKK,FAOI2q8#0

data.body: Folded block of code can't be selected (in order to delete, copy or move folded) as in ST. It unfolds when clicked.

data.title: :bug: Fix regression in indent-guide in React editor
data.body:
Previously the indent guide was always showing on the whitespace only lines in the React editor. This is the same behavior as in the old editor and had the same fix, just ported to `LinesComponent`.

Still TODO:
- [x] Figure out how to port over the test from @kevinsawicki's change

See: 314833bbac33bdb7c45594550d8d10559dd2de9c
Fixes #2274

data.title: @ symbol impossible on QWERTZ keyboard
data.body:
On [QWERTZ keyboards and their derivates](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QWERTZ), which are used in Germany, Switzerland, Austria and most of Central Europe, the key combination for the `@` symbol is `alt-g q`.

When pressing `alt-g q` in Atom Editor, all lines are reformatted so that they break at the preferred line length, instead of entering an `@` symbol.

I've gone through all keybindings, but I could not find any for `alt-g q`.

data.title: Files from NAS drive do not display
data.body: I have tried opening .php and .html files from a NAS drive and while Atom recognizes the file, its type, and sets the syntax checker accordingly, the contents of the file do not display.
